overview: Perfi is a personal finance app that leverage open banking to retrieve transactions data from financial institution accounts, and provide spending stats.
This is my first complex full stack project and required me to learn many new concetps along the way while dealing with disparate challenges.
The app currently have most of the basic featres and it's available to browse in demo mode.
features: Connect to major financial institutions (UK only for now)
Retrieve accounts data and display basic stats (balance, spending)
Retrieve transactions for each account and assign them to pre-defined categories
List transactions by category, month, account
Display aggragated view of spending data using charts
Exclusion/inclusion of individual transactions from spending view
Exclusion/inclusion of all transactions in a specific category from spending view
Assignment of transactions to a category
Auto assignment of similar transactions to a category
Category assignment algorithm adapts to user past choices
User defined categories
Email/password authentication
Financial accounts permission management (renew, add accounts, remove accounts)
Dark/Ligh theme
Fully responsive layout
techFeatures: Typescript for both ExpressJS back-end and ReactJS front-end
PassportJS for user authentication and integration with Express session management
Open banking integration using Plaid (3rd party service)
Database migration, seeding and querying via Sequelize
State management using a conmbination of useState, Redux, and useContext
Data fetching, caching and mutation via RTK Query
Styling and UI components from Material-UI
